moduleDescription: Collecting, managing, and sharing health data

moduleContent.question: Will you set up data governance?
moduleContent.description: Setting up the fundamental governance, and leveraging any existing governance processes about data will be important.

moduleContent.question: Who will see any testing data that you collect
moduleContent.description: This can include not only results, but the fact that someone tested, when and where, the number of times they have tested. Think about roles more so than individuals in this item.

answers.description: Please document who and why.

moduleContent.question: What training is needed based on the role and the type of information a particular person will see?
Do you have HIPAA training available already in your org?

answers.description: You will need to find a source of HIPAA training.

moduleContent.description: Do the licenses cover then number of users that you need to take the training?

moduleContent.question: Do you have other data privacy training available already?
Do you have the needed licenses?
How will you track who needs training and that they have completed it?

answers.answer: A process for staff to report their training completion
answers.description: a copy of certificate, etc.

answers.answer: A spreadsheet of all team members with their required trainings and their completion status

moduleContent.question: What role is responsible for auditing training compliance?

answers.answer: Existing processes to track and report on compliance
Newly established role (Project coordinator of manager)
answers.description: At minimum, this should involve a spreadsheet to track compliance along with what reports on training compliance are needed.  Consider if this persists over several years if training will need to be repeated by an individual.

moduleContent.question: Are there laws or regulations about retention of data?

answers.description: Retention of data should follow all laws and regulations. Document which laws or regulation apply.
Retention of data should follow the useful business life of the data.

moduleContent.question: How will you age data out of your system?

answers.description: You will need to set up deletion in accordance with data retention policy.  Keep in mind system backups may have data which has been deleted from live systems, so document and consider this if restores are performed.

answers.answer: Newly created automation to delete the data
Business processes to manually delete data in accordance with data retention policy.

moduleContent.question: What data will you collect?
moduleContent.description: Data you collect will feed into dashboards if desired

moduleContent.question: Will you need to do correlations with data you have?
moduleContent.description: Siblings or household members that have someone that has tested positive,for example

moduleContent.question: Can you automate correlating data and it is worth the effort?

answers.description: You will need to dedicate resources to automation
You will need to assign someone to manually correlate

moduleContent.question: Do you have the information that you want to correlate already in a digital format?
What IT processes would kick off in the event of a positive or quarantine?
moduleContent.description: Note that all notifications should be HIPAA compliant (no personally identifiable information)

answers.answer: Notifications to establish cleaning of the classroom
Other down streams that need to notified, for example,bus service

moduleContent.question: What sources will you use to generate initial testing rosters?

answers.answer: Other directory information in electronic format

answers.description: not recommended

moduleContent.question: How will testing rosters be kept upto date?

answers.answer: Manual adjustment for adds, moves, changes, deletes
Automated process for adds, moves, changes, deletes

moduleContent.question: What frequency do you need to update the roster?
Which changes will be made to the roster?

answers.answer: Adding a new person into the system
Someone moving from one classroom to another
Someone moving from one school to another

moduleContent.question: Do you have existing processes to keep parent/student contact info up to date that are sufficient?

answers.description: You should leverage the existing process as much as possible
You will need to implement an effort / process to improve contact info quality

moduleContent.question: Will you need to do integrations between testing and other data systems?

answers.description: You will need to establish a way to integrate between systems

moduleContent.question: Will there be any analysis of data to inform decisions about organization operations?
What is your goal/expectation of the analysis?

answers.answer: Determining risk of insufficient in-person staff

moduleContent.question: Who will do analysis of data?
Do you have the hardware, software and skills to do the analysis?

answers.description: You will need to either build what you need in house or leverage a partnership.

moduleContent.question: Are there any compliance efforts related to someone testing or not testing?
How will you determine if someone is in compliance?
How do you notify the person of their being in or out of compliance?
What consequences will there be for being out of compliance?
What formats of reports will you need?
moduleContent.description: Will all reports be digital or will you need some reports to be printed out because of business processes?  For example,will you print out lists of people that are not supposed to be in a building because of compliance, quarantine or isolation?

answers.description: Both Digital and Physical considerations come into play.

moduleContent.question: How do you know reports won’t be digitally copied, retained at the end of useful life?

answers.description: read-only, no downloads

answers.answer: Written expectations of digital report security

moduleContent.question: How will you make sure that copies are only distributed to those that are authorized?

answers.answer: Authentication and authorization to the digital copy
Training covers handling rules of  handling this information

moduleContent.question: How are reports handled at the end of use?
How will you know that there are not any copies lost?

answers.answer: Recall and count all copies distributed
Written expectation of physical report security

moduleContent.question: How do you know reports won’t be digitally copied, retained at the end of useful life?

answers.description: read-only, no downloads

answers.answer: Written expectations of digital report security

moduleContent.question: How are reports handled at the end of use?
How will you know that there are not any copies lost?

answers.answer: Recall and count all copies distributed
Written expectation of physical report security

moduleContent.question: What kind of dashboard will you have?
moduleContent.description: Dashboards are useful and you may want to consider having targeted dashboards based on audience.

answers.description: For the general public to provide overall visibility into the organization.  Examples for this might be total numbers of tests provided, positivity rates.  This would be aggregate data, non-personally identifying numbers.  You would not need authentication for these reports.

For decision makers to include more fine-grained information or the ability to drill down to make decisions. This might be the ability to drill into a location, or group, current and historical data.   Authentication and Authorization for these dashboards are important.

moduleContent.question: What authentication and authorization source(s) will you use for dashboards?

answers.answer: Have someone review dashboard to make sure that security controls are appropriate for the information in the dashboard.

moduleContent.question: Are there any special considerations(including regulations and laws) with respect to security and privacy of this data?
How will you secure access to the data?

answers.answer: Limited access to parts of the data by role

moduleContent.question: Where will your systems be located?
do you have sufficient capacity of both the facilities and the hardware/software?
Does your on-premises infrastructure meet the availability requirements of the system you are creating?
moduleContent.description: For example, if you want your system to be available over the weekend, are you already running infrastructure with similar uptime requirements.

moduleContent.question: How will you meet those requirements?

answers.answer: Leveraging cloud resources to meet availability requirements rather than investing in on-premises hardware.
Evaluate what is needed to meet availability needs and procure, configure, install equipment to meet the new needs.
Adjust availability expectations with the appropriate audiences.

moduleContent.question: will you need additional budget?
Will you need any additional license?
Do you have sufficient capacity of both the facilities and the hardware/software?
Will you need additional budget?
What additional infrastructure will you need to handle the demand made by various components of your ecosystem?

answers.answer: Additional capacity for anticipated load of people accessing the reports/dashboards
Additional infrastructure to meet availability expectations

moduleContent.question: What integrations between various components will be needed to make this work?

answers.answer: Leverage an existing system to generate testing lists
Leverage existing messaging capability to notify students or parents

moduleContent.question: Do you have the integration resources in house, or will you need to leverage a partner/vendor to do the integration?
Do you have capacity for the anticipated scale of messages?
Are there any budget implications for leveraging this messaging system?
Are there any technical or business processes that need to be modified to use this messaging capability?
Is this within the expectations of the end user for how you will use this messaging system?
Do you have an established policy for notifying users of change?
No matter where systems are located, do you need additional work to secure them adequately for this type of data?

answers.description: This would include access to laptops/desktops, securing laptops against theft, security of data centers / server rooms.  (Leverage existing organization security policies and procedures when possible).
This would include appropriate password policies, malware protection, firewalls, logging, auditing, endpoint system management
Does your organization have appropriate policies related to system security and usage?

moduleContent.question: How will the IT infrastructure for this effort be supported?
What is the support expectation?
Will you need any additional resources to provide IT support for this effort?
moduleContent.description: Consider here not just end user support, but the support of infrastructure, integrations, and automations.  What roles will be needed to support any IT/digital infrastructure you are leveraging for this effort.  This might also include managing partners or external vendors.

moduleContent.question: Are there any known issues with digital equity with respect any members of the organization being able to access any aspect of the ecosystem?
Are there community resources that can be leveraged?
Is there a way to lessen any impact because of digital equity?
Are there non-digital ways to deliver service/ service component?
Are there resources that can be loaned?
Are there grants or other resources to address issue?
How will you communicate with users that may have issues because of digital equity the know limitations and any possible solutions for them?
Who will provide end user support to the ecosystem?
moduleContent.description: Users may have questions about testing, how to access results, etc.

moduleContent.question: Is there sufficient capacity in the organization to support the community?
Do they need additional training because people may disclose health information?
How will you coordinate with the partner?
moduleContent.description: You will need to determine the level of disclosure required and if any HIPAA training is needed.

answers.answer: Hand off questions between the partner and your organization
Hand all questions to the partner

moduleContent.question: How will you communicate to end users about who to contact with questions?

Acquire additional equipment for on-premises system

System demand capacity expansion

System storage expansion

Communicate with messaging system users about changes to system related to testing
Create policy to notify system users about system changes
System security assessment and correction as needed

Establish and socialize system policies around security
FAQ for all IT components
